main event: A large red fireball, the size of the end of a pencil held at arm's length, was observed in the sky over Yakima, Washington on December 18, 1957. The object left contrails and exploded, leaving a ball of smoke that lasted until sundown.
interesting points: The object appeared suddenly and lasted for 2-3 seconds.
The object was estimated to be 2-3 feet in diameter.
The object moved quickly to the south.
There were additional sightings of similar red fireballs reported in the area around the same time.
The sighting was reported by a civilian witness who observed it from the ground.
